Description: Shoulder sherd of Milesian Pre-Fikellura pottery neck-amphora or oinochoe; white slip; exterior: junction of neck and shoulder glazed; below, band of unconnected slim lotus buds and flowers.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Cook suggests that Cairo CG26152 belongs to the same vase as Oxford AN1925.608b (which became Leipzig T3432 and is now lost) and Boston 86.636. However, both other sherds have tongue pattern at the top of the shoulder.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 118, no. 330.9, pl. XXXVI, no. 330.9)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 221, no. 87)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.001)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4818 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
